descript.abstract:
The Major Shopping Centers point data file includes those centers with more than 26,000 gross square feet of retail space, open as of December 31, 1998. It does not include single, 'big - box' retail stores sited alone.
Note: The point data is positioned for cartographic purposes for the Metropolitan Council's published Major Shopping Centers In the Twin Cities Metropolitan Area map (Publication No. 74-00-035) and not for precise location (e.g. the points might not fall on the actual shopping center).
descript.purpose: This dataset was developed to update the 1990 Major Shopping Centers In the Twin Cities Metropolitan Area, 1939-1971, 1972-1984, 1985-1989 map published by the Metropolitan Council in the early 1990s, which was published as part of the Shopping Centers and Retail Sales report series. Only the map was updated, not the report.
descript.supplinf: Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.

timeperd.current: Minnesota Shopping Center Association Real Estate Report, 1998. Other sources listed under Lineage.

theme.themekey: shopping centers, major shopping centers, retail, society

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County

browse.browsed: Sample map showing the Major Shopping Centers dataset.

dataqual.complete: Entire seven county geographic area is covered.

horizpa.horizpar:
The positional accuracy of the dataset has not been tested under the National Standards for Spatial Data Accuracy.
The shopping center point locations were derived from a list of addresses that had some problems when address matched to street centerlines. Some addresses were modified to improve address matching results.
Some of the resulting points were repositioned for cartographic purposes and labeling for the published Major Shopping Centers map (Publication No. 74-00-035). Thus, some of the points, especially in major shopping center areas, are not in their precise location (e.g. the points might not fall on the actual shopping center).

procstep.procdesc:
The Metropolitan Council research staff developed a database of shopping centers with ID numbers, addresses, gross square footage, year of construction, year renovated, and center type (regional, sub-regional, etc.) from the sources listed below. Not all of these attributes were carried through to the final point data file.
This database was address matched with ArcView 3.2 using the TLG Street Centerlines dataset. Some of the addresses were modified during this process to achieve better address matching results. Some of the resulting points were then repositioned for cartographic purposes for the published Major Shopping Centers map (Publication No. 74-00-035). Some of the points, especially in major shopping center locations, are not in their precise location (e.g. the points might not fall on the actual shopping center).
Data Source: Minnesota Shopping Center Association 1997 and 1998 Real Estate Reports 1990 Shopping Center Update Report by Metropolitan Council, December 1990 Field surveys of developing areas
Notes: The shopping centers listed are only those with more than 26,000 gross square feet of retail space. Single, 'big - box' retail stores sited alone are not included in the list.

spdoinfo.mgmg3til: One layer for entire seven county region.

overview.eaover:
FID: Internal Feature Number
Shape: Internal Feature Geometry
CENTER_ID: ID reference number used to index the shopping centers on the published map to the index on the back of the map.
NAME: Shopping center name
TYPE: Shopping center type
TYPE_NO: Numeric value for each shopping center type to allow sorting by type in a certain order.
ADDRESS: Shopping center address
CITY: The city in which the shopping center resides.
ZIP_CODE: Shopping center's zip code
overview.eadetcit:
TYPE: Referenced from �Shopping Center Update with Retail Sales Data from the 1997 Economic Census, August 2001, Metropolitan Council�
Mega Center - Mall of America is the only center in this category which is not defined on the basis of size but because of its unique character
Regional Center - centers that exceed 750,000 gross square feet of retail space
Sub-Regional Center - centers have between 400,000 and 750,000 square feet of retail space
Downtown Center - contains mixed use developments that occur in highly urbanized downtown locations and are not categorized on the basis of gross, leasable retail space.
Community Center - centers have between 100,000 and 400,000 square feet of retail space
Neighborhood Center - centers contain less than 100,000 square feet of retail space and are the smallest centers categorized

The GIS Data were developed by the Metropolitan Council for its own internal business purposes. The Metropolitan Council does not represent or warrant that the GIS Data or the data documentation are error-free, complete, current, or accurate. You are responsible for any consequences resulting from your use of the GIS Data or your reliance on the GIS Data. You should consult the data documentation for this particular GIS Data to determine the limitations of the GIS Data and the precision with which the GIS Data may depict distance, direction, location, or other geographic features. If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, it is recommended that the GIS Data include a copy of this disclaimer and this metadata.

digtinfo.transize: Less than 1 meg. for zip file.

stdorder.ordering:
This dataset is distributed on the internet by clicking below after 'Online Linkage'. Doing so will tell your browser to download a 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:
- ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a web mapping service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/. The specific map service and layer name for this dataset can be found by clicking the blue or green boxes under the map service column of the DataFinder Catalog at http://www.datafinder.org/catalog/ .
